verses.text: When David was old and full of days, he made Solomon his son king over Israel.
verses.comment: Matches MT and LXX. 'Full of days' is a literal rendering.

verses.text: He gathered together all the leaders of Israel, with the priests and the Levites.
verses.comment: Text is consistent with the Hebrew.

verses.text: The Levites, who were thirty years old and above, were numbered, and their total number by headcount, was thirty-eight thousand men.
verses.comment: ‘Thirty years old and above’ matches MT. Some later verses adjust this age.

verses.text: Of these, twenty-four thousand were to oversee the work of the house of the Lord, six thousand were officers and judges,
verses.comment: ‘Officers and judges’ are literal translations from the Hebrew.

verses.text: four thousand were gatekeepers, and four thousand praised the Lord with the instruments that David had made for giving praise.
David assigned them into divisions according to the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
verses.comment: List is consistent with the Pentateuch.

verses.text: The sons of Gershon: Ladan and Shimei.
The sons of Ladan: Jehiel the chief, Zetham, and Joel, three.
The sons of Shimei: Shelomoth, Haziel, and Haran, three. These were the heads of the families of Ladan.
The sons of Shimei: Jahath, Zina, Jeush, and Beriah. These four were the sons of Shimei.
verses.comment: Names as per MT. ‘Zina’ may also be ‘Zizah’ per some manuscripts.

verses.text: Jahath was the chief, and Zizah the second. But Jeush and Beriah did not have many sons, so they were counted as one family.
verses.comment: ‘Counted as one family’ is a clarifying, literal phrase.

verses.text: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, four.

The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses. Aaron was set apart, he and his sons forever, to consecrate the most holy things, to burn offerings before the Lord, to minister to him and to bless in his name forever.
But as for Moses the man of God, his sons were named among the tribe of Levi.
verses.comment: ‘Man of God’ is a Hebrew title for Moses.

verses.text: The sons of Moses: Gershom and Eliezer.
The son of Gershom: Shebuel the chief.
verses.comment: Shebuel is a leader of the Gershonites.

verses.text: The son of Eliezer was Rehabiah the chief. Eliezer had no other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were very numerous.
The son of Izhar: Shelomith the chief.
The sons of Hebron: Jeriah the chief, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
The sons of Uzziel: Micah the chief, and Isshiah the second.
The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli: Eleazar and Kish.
Eleazar died and had no sons, but only daughters. Their relatives, the sons of Kish, married them.
verses.comment: Details marriage customs as in Numbers.

verses.text: The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jeremoth, three.

These were the sons of Levi by their ancestral houses—the heads of families, listed by name, and counted individually—who did the work for the service of the house of the Lord, from the age of twenty years and up.
verses.comment: The service age here is lowered to 20.

verses.text: For David said, 'The Lord, the God of Israel, has given rest to his people, and he dwells in Jerusalem forever.'
verses.comment: Following the context of temple rest.

verses.text: So the Levites no longer needed to carry the tabernacle or any of its vessels for its service.
verses.comment: Describes the end of the wandering period.

verses.text: For according to the last words of David, the Levites were numbered from twenty years old and above.

For their duty was to assist the sons of Aaron for the service of the house of the Lord—taking care of the courts and the chambers, the cleansing of all that is holy, and the work of the service of the house of God.
verses.comment: Duties reflect temple rather than tabernacle service.

verses.text: They were to take care of the showbread, the fine flour for the grain offering, the unleavened wafers, the baked offering, the offering mixed with oil, and all measures of quantity and size.
verses.comment: ‘All measures’—refers to weights and measures used in worship.

verses.text: And they were to stand every morning to thank and praise the Lord, and likewise at evening,
as well as at every burnt offering to the Lord—on Sabbaths, new moons, and appointed feasts—according to the number required of them, regularly before the Lord.
And so they kept charge of the Tent of Meeting and the holy place, and helped the sons of Aaron their brothers in the service of the house of the Lord.
